intro: Myrsine boivinii, commonly known as the Madagascar myrsine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, red berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Myrsine boivinii is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
